Adani Enterprises, the group's flagship company, was trading 8% higher at Rs 2,401.75.

JSW Energy shares price rises 6% today. Here's why JSW Energy share price: The stock has lost 20.14% in the last month and 23.69% over the past six months. Despite the recent decline, JSW Energy has gained 16.15% over the past year.

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: BJP vs AAP on Delhi bomb hoax emails as cops reveal NGO connectDelhi Police has uncovered key details while investigating hoax bomb emails sent to over 400 schools, which caused widespread alarm among students and disrupted classes.

Rift in Team India? BCCI to evaluate Gambhir's future post Champions TrophyGautam Gambhir's role as head coach is under scrutiny as India's Champions Trophy performance could determine his future, amid tensions over his efforts to dismantle the 'superstar culture' within the team. Concerns have arisen due to India's recent poor results and speculated rifts with key players, leading to a review by the BCCI.

Why the way to power in Delhi is through its slumsAhead of the Delhi Assembly election, the AAP, BJP, and Congress have sharpened their pitch on slums and are courting the city's over three million slum dwellers. The residents of the 675 slums in Delhi form around 15% of Delhi's electorate, and any swing in their voting pattern will impact the fortunes of the parties.

Meta in trouble after Zuckerberg's election claim, faces parliamentary summonsMeta boss Mark Zuckerberg had suggested that most incumbent governments worldwide, including India, were defeated in elections held post-Covid-19. His statement triggered a massive political row.

First full Moon of 2025 to devour Mars. You can see it with your eyesThis lunar occultation is a rare spectacle; observers in specific locations only can expect to witness this event that happens only about once every 14 years.

Psychologist arrested for raping 50 girls in 15 years under guise of counsellingThe psychologist, identified as Rajesh Dhoke, a father of two, lured young girls under the guise of providing counselling at residential camps.

INDIA for national polls: Sharad Pawar fuels MVA rift talk ahead of civic pollsSharad Pawar on Tuesday hinted that the party was likely to follow in the footsteps of Uddhav Sena and contest the Mumbai civic polls alone. The remark comes as the MVA is smarting from its Assembly election drubbing.

Rahul Gandhi's 'Paris wali Dilli' dig at Arvind Kejriwal as INDIA rift widensEscalating his attack on Arvind Kejriwal, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi visited a stream strewn with garbage in Delhi and took a jibe at the AAP chief's promise of making the national capital clean like Paris.

Rahul Gandhi vs Arvind Kejriwal: Is this beginning of the end for INDIA bloc?While Congress and the AAP were unnatural allies to begin with, the fallout ahead of the Delhi elections could have a ripple effect on opposition unity. The tremors have also been felt far away in Maharashtra, with the civic polls around the corner.

Charaideo Moidams: Assam's ancient burial mounds get UNESCO heritage certificateAssam's Charaideo Moidams, ancient burial mounds of the Ahom dynasty, received the UNESCO World Heritage certificate on Tuesday. It is the first cultural site from Northeast India on the list.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
